personalInfo.clubAffl: Riomar Country Club / Trump International Puerto Rico (Puerto Rico)

tourBios.curYrHigh: As one of only two players to make a start in every Puerto Rico Open at Coco Beach, Dicky Pride being the other, Puerto Rico native Rafael Campos opened with a bogey-free, 8-under 64 to take a one-stroke lead over 2012 champion, George McNeill. Maintained his lead through 36 holes, before weekend rounds of 1-under 71 resulted in a share of eighth place with Will Mackenzie and Aaron Baddeley. With his top-10 finish, earned a spot into the following week's Shell Houston Open field, marking just the second different PGA TOUR event in which he has competed.
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Opened the year making his eighth career start on the PGA TOUR's Puerto Rico Open in March (MC)… His fourth career season on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica was his best as a pro. Collected two runner-up finishes, five top-10s and nine top-25s in 17 starts to close the year ranked third on the Order of Merit and join “Los Cinco” who graduated to the Web.com Tour… Was the only player ranked inside the top-5 without a victory… Led the Tour in total birdies (267), sub-par rounds (39) and tied for first in rounds in the 60s (26)… Had a Tour leading 14 consecutive cuts made to close the season… Made a late season charge, finishing second, sixth and second in three consecutive starts in October to raise from 38th to third on the Order of Merit… His two runner-up finishes came at the Hyundai-BBVA Abierto de Chile, where he shot 23-under to lose by one to Wil Bateman, and the Roberto De Vicenzo Punta del Este Open, where he lost by two to former college roommate Lanto Griffin…. His three other top-10s were 4th at the Honduras Open in May, 6th at the Mundo Maya Open in October and T7 at the season ending PGA TOUR Latinoamérica Tour Championship presented by First Bank at the TPC Dorado Beach in Puerto Rico… Teamed up with his countryman Edward Figueroa to finish second at the Bridgestone America's Golf Cup, a PGA TOUR Latinoamérica unofficial event featuring 30 two-man teams in Mexico City. Shot 30-under of best ball to finish four behind tournament champions Matt Kuchar and Justin Hueber of the U.S… A week after finishing the Latinoamérica season, he collected a T34 finish at the Web.com Tour Q-School final stage at PGA National to improve his status for the 2016 season.

2014: Finished T29 at the PGA TOUR's Puerto Rico Open in March. That was his best finish and thid cut made in seven starts on that event. Got off to a slow start of 74, but then shot 69, 67 and 69 to finish at 9-under par 279 at Trump International GC in Rio Grande, Puerto Rico… Finished the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season ranked No. 22 on the Order of Merit following four top-10s, seven top-25s and nine cuts made in 16 starts. His best finish was T3 at the Roberto De Vicenzo Invitational Copa NEC in Montevideo, Uruguay in April. Got off to another strong start on the final round, to tie for the lead halfway through the afternoon and seemed to have a good shot at the title. His good putting touch went away on the back nine and the three-footer he missed for par on 17 cost him a shot at making the playoff for the title. His other top-10s came at the Arturo Calle Colombian Classic (solo fourth), the Abierto de Chile (T7) and the Stella Artois Open (T10).

2013: Finished 76th on his sixth appearance at the PGA TOUR's Puerto Rico Open in March. He became the first Puerto Rican to make the cut two times in the Puerto Rico Open. He was also the first to make the cut since the event's inaugural year of 2008… Finished the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season ranked No. 23 in the Order of Merit. Had three top-10s, six top-25s and nine cuts made in 13 starts. His best finish was T6 at the Mundo Maya Open in Merida, Mexico in May. Finished T7 at the Puerto Rico Classic presented by Merrill Lynch, an event he closed shooting 5-under par on the last six holes to finish three strokes behind the winner. His other top 10 finish was T9 at the Personal Classic in Buenos Aires, Argentina in December… Made the cut in two of three starts on PGA TOUR Canada, with a T27 finish at The Great Waterway Classic as his best in August.

2012: Missed the cut on his fifth career start on the PGA TOUR's Puerto Rico Open in March… Finished the inaugural season of PGA TOUR Latinoamérica ranked No. 14 in the Order of Merit. Had three top-10 finishes, five top-25 finishes and eight cuts made in ten starts. Finished T4 at both the Mundo Maya Open and the 59th Aberto do Brasil. Held the outright lead through three rounds in Brazil, but carded a final round 76 to miss on his chance at a first Tour title. His other top-10 finish was T9 at the TransAmerican Power Products Open in Monterrey, Mexico… During the first half of the year he finished the abbreviated final season of the Tour de las Americas ranked No. 3 in the Order of Merit to earn his PGA TOUR Latinoamérica card. His best TLA finishes were runner-up at the International Open La Vitalicia in Barquisimeto, Venezuela in March and T4 at the Taca Airlines Open in Lima, Peru in June.

2011: Turned professional in January… Missed the cut on his fourth career start on the PGA TOUR's Puerto Rico Open in March… Had two top-10s in eight starts on the Tour de las Americas to finish No. 52 in the Order of Merit… His best finish was solo eighth at the Pacific Colombia Tour Championship, an event also sanctioned by PGA TOUR Canada in Bogota, Colombia… Made the cut in one of two starts on the Web.com Tour, T52 at the Panama Claro Championship in February.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Made his PGA TOUR debut by making the cut at the inaugural edition of the Puerto Rico Open in 2008 as a 20 year-old… Also played the event as an amateur in 2009 and 2010, missing the cut both times… Claimed the Puerto Rico Amateur Championship four years in a row between 2007 and 2010… Finished 17th at the 2010 World Amateur Team Championship in Buenos Aires, Argentina.
tourBios.personal: Has a twin sister, Cristina… Has an older sister and a younger brother too… Graduated from Virginia Commonwealth University in 2010 with a degree in business… Affiliated to Riomar Country Club and Trump International Puerto Rico… Likes fishing and sports… Claims to be a terrific Ping-Pong player… Started playing golf at age 9… Twitter and Instagram: @RafaCamposGolf

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 11-45 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament (exempt to second reshuffle)

Maintained his lead through 36 holes, before weekend rounds of 1-under 71 resulted in a share of eighth place with Will Mackenzie and Aaron Baddeley. With his top-10 finish, earned a spot into the following week's Shell Houston Open field, marking just the second different PGA TOUR event in which he has competed.

dyn.dynResults: He has finished 2nd on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri 2 times.
